tests.name: Search React Hooks Usage
tests.description: Find all React components using useEffect hook
tests.baseline_prompt: Search through all JavaScript files and find components that use the useEffect hook. Show me each occurrence with the file path and line number.
tests.agent_prompt: Use house-research to find all React components using the useEffect hook

tests.name: Security Vulnerability Search
tests.description: Find eval(), innerHTML, and SQL injection patterns
tests.baseline_prompt: Search the entire codebase for security issues: find all instances of eval(), innerHTML usage, and SQL queries using string concatenation. Report each finding with file path, line number, and the problematic code.
tests.agent_prompt: Use house-research to find all instances of eval(), innerHTML, or SQL injection vulnerabilities (string concatenation in SQL queries)

tests.name: Stripe Webhook Configuration
tests.description: Configure Stripe webhook handling from documentation
tests.baseline_prompt: Fetch the Stripe webhooks documentation and create a working Express.js middleware that handles subscription webhook events (created, updated, canceled) with proper signature verification.
tests.agent_prompt: Use house-mcp to set up Stripe webhook handling for subscription events (created, updated, canceled) with signature verification

tests.name: Test Suite Analysis
tests.baseline_prompt: Run 'npm test' in the repository and analyze the output. Tell me which tests failed, what the error messages were, and suggest fixes for each failure.
tests.agent_prompt: Use house-bash to run npm test and analyze any failures

tests.name: npm Install Summary
tests.baseline_prompt: Run 'npm install' and tell me what packages were installed, if there were any warnings or errors, and summarize the key information.
tests.agent_prompt: Use house-bash to run npm install and summarize what was installed

tests.name: Git Diff Analysis
tests.description: Review a large git diff with multiple file changes
tests.baseline_prompt: Run 'git diff HEAD~5..HEAD' and analyze all the changes. Tell me what files changed, categorize the changes by importance, and highlight any critical modifications I should review carefully. Show me specific line numbers for important changes.
tests.agent_prompt: Use house-git to review changes from the last 5 commits (HEAD~5..HEAD) and highlight key modifications
tests.notes: Requires medium repo to have git history with actual changes

metadata.notes: Each test should be run 3 times for statistical reliability. Average the results.
